greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = p(n) - sigma(n), where p(n) is the least prime greater than sigma(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: phi(4) = 7 and the least prime > 7 is 11; hence a(4) = 11 - 7 = 4.
mathematica: ps[n_]:=Module[{sn=DivisorSigma[1,n]}, NextPrime[sn]-sn]; ps/@Range[100] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 02 2011 *)
results.author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Aug 11 2002
